1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.2__Maacha: : She is called elsewhere Michaia, daughter of Uriel; but it was common in those days for the same person to have two names.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.10__His mother: : That is, his grandmother; unless we suppose, which is not improbable, that the Maacha here named is different from the Maacha mentioned, ver. 2.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.14__The high places: : There were excelsa or high places of two different kinds. Some were set up, and dedicated to the worship of idols, or strange gods; and these Asa removed, 2 Par. 14. 2; others were only altars of the true God, but were erected contrary to the law, which allowed of no sacrifices but in the temple; and these were not removed by Asa.-- Ibid.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__15.14__Perfect with the Lord: : Asa had his faults; but never forsook the worship of the Lord.
